channel.title: BBC News - Technology

item.title: Facebook: Damian Collins and US politicians criticise data ban
item.description: Damian Collins accuses the company of shutting down legitimate research to protect its own interests.

item.title: Number pinged by NHS Covid-19 app falls significantly
item.description: The fall is based on data gathered before changes to the app which mean it will notify fewer contacts.

item.title: Google Maps warns drivers about emission charges
item.description: Drivers heading through London or Paris will receive a warning about clean-air fees and fines.

item.title: Cross words over New York Times puzzle change
item.description: The US-based publication is cutting third party support for its popular crossword puzzles.

item.title: Nearly a third of waking hours spent on TV and streaming, Ofcom says
item.description: Older people have been watching more linear TV while on-demand is a big hit with younger audiences.

item.title: Keeping old computers going costs government £2.3bn a year, says report
item.description: Just under half the entire IT budget goes on patching up outdated systems, a government report says.

item.title: MP Maria Miller wants AI 'nudifying' tool banned
item.description: A website that allows people to undress a photograph in seconds is gaining lots of users.

item.title: TikTok tests Snapchat style vanishing video stories feature
item.description: The news comes as Facebook's WhatsApp starts to roll out a disappearing photos and videos feature.

item.title: WhatsApp 'view once' brings disappearing photos and videos
item.description: The "view once" feature lets users open an image one time only before it is deleted forever.

item.title: Facebook and academics row over data access
item.description: The social network accuses researchers of putting people's privacy at risk.

item.title: Blizzard Entertainment president steps down
item.description: J Allen Brack quits the Call of Duty and Warcraft game-maker, amid staff protests and allegations of a sexist workplace culture.

item.title: Lauren Goodger foreign exchange Instagram advert banned
item.description: The TV star had been paid for a post that a watchdog says wasn't obviously identifiable as an ad.

item.title: How smart buildings could transform our experience of work
item.description: Lara Lewington visits a new smart office block to see how technology could transform working lives.

item.title: CEO Secrets: Airbnb boss shares his business advice
item.description: Brian Chesky, co-founder and CEO of Airbnb, shares his business advice for the CEO Secrets series.

item.title: Untethered bi-pedal robot runs 5km and other tech news
item.description: Jen Copestake looks at some of the best technology news stories of the week.

item.title: Team BRIT’s Aaron Morgan: How hand controls help me race
item.description: The Team BRIT driver on how adapted cars help him compete in races against non-disabled drivers.

item.title: Vineyards set to go high tech with smart systems
item.description: Changing climate conditions and water shortages see some Australian wine growers turn to technology.

item.title: The perfect storm striking World of Warcraft
item.description: All of a sudden, WoW players are in revolt, and its competitors are having a boom.

item.title: Tokyo 2020: TikTok becomes the unofficial behind-the-scenes Olympic channel
item.description: The short-form video platform is giving fans unprecedented insight into the athletes' experience.

item.title: The fungus and bacteria tackling plastic waste
item.description: Bacteria, fungus and enzymes can all digest plastic, but can they work at a useful commercial scale?

item.title: Can better tech make video meetings less excruciating?
item.description: Technology firms are scrambling to add new features but will video calls improve.

item.title: Why remote working leaves us vulnerable to cyber-attacks
item.description: Experts warn working from home has led to complacency over security protocols

item.title: Covid: Will lockdown change England's new tech habits?
item.description: The pandemic brought about big changes in the way people use tech - the question is will they last?

item.title: What does a future-proofed home look like?
item.description: The technology exists to make homes more resilient to extreme weather, but it can be expensive.

item.title: Zoomtown-on-Sea? The lure of a new life on the coast
item.description: Remote working meant the Lancaster family could live anywhere - they found their sea view in Scarborough.

item.title: Pegasus scandal: Are we all becoming unknowing spies?
item.description: We may be stepping into a world in which we are all spies - and at the same time are all spied on.

item.title: Finding 'Grace': Murder, DNA and ancestry
item.description: How a novel use of DNA and ancestry websites is helping police uncover clues in cold case murders.
